name: Arch Linux (Rolling)
install_guide_markdown: Use the official installation guide: partition, mount, pacstrap, fstab, chroot, configure bootloader, create user, and install your desktop.

install_steps.title: Boot live ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Boot the ISO and ensure network is up (`iwctl` for Wi-Fi).

install_steps.title: Partition and format
install_steps.detail_md: Use fdisk/parted to create EFI + root; format with ext4 or btrfs.

install_steps.title: Install base system
install_steps.detail_md: Run pacstrap with base, linux, firmware, and minimal tools.

commands.command: pacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmware nano networkmanager

install_steps.title: Configure system
install_steps.detail_md: Generate fstab, set locale, users, enable NetworkManager, and install bootloader (systemd-boot or GRUB).

privacy_notes: No telemetry included; you control all installed components.
notes: Best for users comfortable with manual installation and rolling releases.
